intro: Eleocharis elliptica, commonly known as the narrowleaf spike-rush, is a species of sedge native to wetland environments in North America. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes, ponds, and along the edges of lakes. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like clusters of white to pale brown flowers. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and improve water quality. Eleocharis elliptica plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
